loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old.  She is married to a carpenter and lives in Isabela.  She has three children. 

For two years, Evelyn has owned a sari-sari store (mini store) located in front of her house. Evelyn believes that she needs to work hard and be patient in all aspects of life. She is asking a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy snack foods, drinks, spices and noodles for her mini store. She hopes that her store expands so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 67 years old, is married and has ten children. She works hard to provide for her family.  Erlinda has been running a general store in the Philippines for 16 years. She also earns an income from buying and selling rice and ready-to-wear clothing. Erlinda has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, 53 years old, is married and has 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Gemma has run a general store in the Philippines for 20 years. She also earns an income from selling rice. Gemma has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. Gemma has previously borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Ardiane

texts.en:
Ardiane lives in the northern part of Kosovo. She is twenty-nine years old, married, and has two children, ages two and five years old. Her husband doesn’t work. Based on family tradition, she works in an agricultural business.
 
She has two milk cows, which she uses for her family's needs. She also sells milk products in her area. She typically can average ten liters per day, half of which is for distribution at 50 cents a liter. Ardiane is asking for a loan to buy another milk cow. This loan will help her to increase her income, doubling the amount she can sell from five to ten liters of milk per day.
 
Her goal is to expand her farm; thereby, giving her enough money to provide a better education for her children.
 
Ardiane would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Floripe

texts.en:
This is Floripe.  She previously received a PHP 8,000 loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were big for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Floripe dreams of expanding her business and helping her children finish their studies through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of ther work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and married with one child.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Arlene aspires to save enough for the renovation of her house and expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Ey's Group

texts.en:
Ey, 42, is a married mother of four children, one of whom is in school and still dependent on her. Her family lives in a rural area in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has been in rice farming on two hectares of farmland for twelve years to make a living. She can earn about 12,000 KHR per day and saves about 7,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. The main challenge for her is scarcity of fertilizer to support her rice paddy. 

Ey's group consists of four female members.  This is Ey’s first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other members have been with VisionFund for two to three cycles.  Ey is now leading her group of four to ask for a loan.  She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and  pay for labor costs. She hopes her rice will become more productive and profitable so as to make her living better.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en: Jelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines for 6 years. She earns additional income from her general store. Jelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell. Jelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida, 57 years old, is married and has 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Leonida has run a general store in the Philippines for 6 years. She also earns an income from selling rice. Leonida has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Leonida has previously borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy, 50 years old, is widowed and has 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 12 years, Lucy has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as noodles, eggs, sugar, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her business. In the future Lucy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her business

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng, aged 51, lives in a wooden house located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and has eight children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. The family's main sources of income for the last 30 years have been rice farming and palm juice production. They can earn about KHR 15,000 per day, of which they save about 10,000 KHR after daily expenses.
 
Heng has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles while Sinat is in her first cycle. The past loans have helped Heng to relieve her family’s burden and to improve their livelihood. She and her group member are now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Heng is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice more productively so as to sell it for a good price in order to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is married with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Macaria is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

Macaria has a desktop publishing and printing business in the Philippines. Macaria requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase some additional materials and equipment for her business.

Macaria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Macaria would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: To purchase some additional materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita, 62, is a widow and has six adult-aged children. She lives with one of her children who is now married. To make an income everyday, she has managed a general store for the past six years. She earns PHP10,000 income from the business monthly. 


She is requesting the amount of PHP20,000 to buy additional retail product offering such as rice, fish sauce, and more stock of daily merchandise such as soda, bottled and canned goods. 


Warlita's proceed of income from business is planned to buy a pig and hog feed to have extra source of income and is intended for use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, fish sauce and additional stocks like soda, bottled and canned goods.

loans.name: Nely Vicenta

texts.en:
Nely Vicenta is 38 years old and is married with 4 children.

Nely Vicenta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory.

Nely Vicenta has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Nely Vicenta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nenita has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia,62, is widowed with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, shampoo, soap, etc.

In the future Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 41 years old. She is very intent on lifting up her family from poor living.  She just finished her vocational course and she promised to herself that she will provide a better living to her family. There are many businesses in which she is engaged--one of these is a hog raising business. Through this she’s able to provide daily needs of her family.


She wants to improve and boost her income. This caused her to request a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs, as well as flour, sugar, and milk for her food vending business. She hopes to achieve her requested loan to further improve her businesses and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins as well as flour, sugar, and milk for her food vending business

loans.name: Richael

texts.en:
Richael is 31 years old and married with one child.

Richael works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Richael has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for two years and also earns an income from selling gasoline, rice, and charcoal.

Richael aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, 35, has five children. He lives with his spouse and children in the town of Tiribe, Kenya. He has been operating a tailoring business for the last two months; he previously worked as a mason. He is very optimistic and hopes to earn a good income, because there is not much competition in his area. This is one of the reasons that he started this business. To improve his production, he’s asking for a 15,000 KES loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, lace, and other items to make garments. He will be able to increase his production and sales with this investment. His goal is to work hard so that his children will have a quality education and to have enough money to make some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, lace, and other items to make garments

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their six children. Mupa has been selling fish for ten years, and it has been going well for her. This type of business is profitable because she sells every day.

Mupa has requested her third loan with Yehu for 40,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. This will allow her to continue offering better service and to have more customers. Mupa's goal is to provide better service in order to have a better income. She wants to be able to educate her children. Mupa has a good credit reference and she hopes to repay this loan, as she has done with the previous loans, so as to remain faithful and trustworthy for more loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad, 49 years old, is a good wife and mother. She has a hog fattening business as a source of income and to help her husband.  Natividad focuses on her business in order to earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and vitamins. Natividad hopes to earn a higher income this time for the financial security of her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy. 57 years old, is blessed with three grown children who already have their own families. She is now alone in life and needs to promote her own self.  Daisy engaged herself in selling bottles after she cleans them. She earns PHP 150 per day, which she usually uses to purchase her commodities. Daisy wants to improve her yields, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more bottles to sell. Despite the difficulty of this business, Daisy patiently works hard to soon achieve a greater income.

loans.use: to buy more bottles to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Narcisa is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Narcisa manufactures and sells hand-made baskets.  She has been doing this for 7 years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Narcisa joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 3500, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy materials to make baskets

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and married with 3 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 11500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosemarie has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income from rice and charcoal retail and fish vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been engaged in a retail business for eight years. Despite her age, she successfully provides a good source of income through her diligence. She is aiming for a higher income that would make her living condition better. This motivated her to borrow a loan amount PHP 15,000 to buy bottles, plastics and aluminum to resell at a higher price. She wants to grow her primary business so that she will able to save for her future use.

loans.use: buy bottles, plastics and aluminum to resell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a peanut business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of peanut to sell in her peanut business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy peanut to resell

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 44 years old and married with one son who works for others for a fee. She lives in a rural area in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. To meet the family’s needs, Srey has been in raising ten pigs.   Her husband also complements their income by catching fish in the local area. Having been in this business for twelve years, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manage to save around 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

This is the first microloan for Srey’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group member are asking for a loan in amount of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, Srey is going to use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig-raising business and materials to support her husband’s fishing business such as​ cast nets and fish traps, etc. She hopes to increase more income from her current business so as to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 50 years old.  She is a bottle dealer in her village. She buys bottles to clean up and sell to manufacturers of vinegar at their place. As of now, she is earning to help her husband support their family.   She usually earns an average of PHP 200 daily which she uses to buy food for them.

Francisca is requesting a loan amount PHP 10,000 to buy more bottles to clean and sell. She is hoping that her usual income would then be increased through the loan she had requested.

loans.use: buy bottles to sell

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher is a 29-year-old young woman.  She is divorced with no children.

For the past five years, Samaher has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for her, but it is not enough to cover her costs.

Samaher is requesting a USD 1,000 youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar and dairy products. This will offer to Samaher a variety collection of groceries to resell, which will increase sales and increase her income.

Samaher is photographed in her grocery store.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 52-year-old who engages herself in cleaning and selling bottles as a source of income.  The poor quality of life for her family led her to become more hard-working, so with her business she patiently buys bottles, cleans and sells them. She has been doing this for two years and is hoping to increase her income through asking for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to buy additional bottles to clean and sell.  She hopes to earn more for the betterment of their lives and also to save for their future.

loans.use: buy recycled bottles to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 6 years. She earns additional income from raising chickens. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 43 years old, is from a village in Quezon. She is married and has three adult children. Gemma is a former domestic helper who worked abroad for many years. 

For the past 3 years, Gemma has managed a general store as an added source of income for her family. She is able to earn PHP 1,000 each week from this business. Gemma is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy fish, meat and vegetables as added product offerings, along with more grocery stock. Gemma will use the income generated from the business to support immediate members of her family and as savings for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat and vegetables as added product offerings, along with more grocery stock

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 40 years and single, with four kids. She has been in the hotel business for the past 12 years, earning about KES 8,000 monthly. This is her second loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. 


She borrowed KES 30,000, which she plans to use on purchasing maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and rice for use in her cafeteria. 

With the anticipated profits, she plans to use it in repaying her loan and the remaining amount for running her business. She hopes to take care of her children’s needs and education.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 58 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Alicia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, bread, coffee, etc.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Flor Cristel

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer de 41 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Flor pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su madres, Flor puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, adicionalmente ella también trabaja como profesora de educación primaria en un pequeño colegio de su ciudad, Flor puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Flor se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: perfumes, cosméticos, shampo, cremas, maquillaje, entre otros; de esta manera Flor tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is a woman of 41 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person. She has a great wish to excel. Thanks to her effort and her parents support, Flor was able to study the professional career of education. In her free time, she likes to walk in the warm and welcoming streets of her city. Sometimes, she cooks a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca [Creole stew] to share with her family. 

With much effort, enthusiasm and thanks to the support of her mother, Flor launched her small business selling beauty products. Additionally, she also works as a school teacher in a small school in her city. Flor works about 10 hours a day and thinks she is doing well because of her dedication and for the kind treatment she gives to others.

Flor is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, creams, and makeup, among others. This way, Flor will have her business better stocked, so she will boost sales and increase her income. That will be very useful to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business, such as perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, creams, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from Malibangcao, Clarin. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Rosa has been cultivating corn for 10 years and earns 6,400 PHP a month from these activities. 

Rosa is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Rosa joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie, a 43-year-old married mother of seven children, five of whom are in school, has been buying and selling livestock in the Philippines for 30 years now, Having received 12  previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business,  Amie has requested a new one for PHP 29500 to buy additional livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, a 29-year-old single woman, works hard to support her parents. She has a dry goods retail business in the Philippines, and also earns income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 44 years old and married with 8 children.

Belinda earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Belinda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Belinda is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité  Divino  Niño Jesus se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora de una de las miembros y gracias al trabajo de todas ya están en el tercer ciclo.
Antonia, una de estas mujeres, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y precio. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante y por medio de esto ayudar a su familia. Su sueño es poder ir creciendo con su trabajo y el día de mañana tener una gran tienda.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de remeras, camisas, pantalones, etc. y con eso poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Divino Niño Jesus (Divine Baby Jesus) was formed at the initiative of one of its members, and thanks to the work of everyone, they are now in their third loan cycle. Antonia, one of these women, relates that she sells clothing of all types and prices. She comments that thanks to her work, she has been able to advance and through this to help her family. Her dream is to be able to continue growing in her work and in the future to have a big store.

She is applying for the loan to purchase T-shirts, shirts, pants, etc., and with this to be able to continue working and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, pants, etc. to sell

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comite San Miguel  es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por 12 mujeres de esa ciudad, todas ellas amigas y vecinas que se esfuerzan por dar a sus familias todo lo que desean para un mejor porvenir.
Juana la presidenta vende comidas, y comenta que le va muy bien. Ella es una persona que se esfuerza siempre y trata de dar lo mejor de su para salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, pollo, verduras y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
The San Miguel committee is from the city of San Lorenzo. It is composed of 12 women from this city, all of whom are friends and neighbors who work hard to give their families all of what they desire to achieve a better future.

Juana, the president, sells food and she told us that it is going very well. She is a person who always works hard and who tries to do her best to get ahead. She seeks the loan to buy meat, condiments, chicken, vegetables and more, with which she will be able to continue making the meals that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, chicken, vegetables and more to make meals.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
This is Herminia, 50, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Asterio, an aircraft mechanic and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Herminia maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Herminia hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Sonia tiene 36 años de edad, la señora  tiene venta de ropas y bazar en su casa y además tiene un puesto en el mercado  donde hortalizas como lechuga, cebollita de hoja, perejil, acelga y otros. Este trabajo lo realiza por la mañana a tempranas horas y para el medio día ya regresa  a su casa.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, cuenta que no se cansa, ya que todo lo que hace es por su familia, y dice que ellos lo merecen todo.
La Sra. Sonia solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas, con lo cual podrá surtir su bazar y seguir dando variedad a sus clientes, a lo que siempre están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
Sonia is 36 years old, sells clothes and has a small store in her home. Additionally, she has a stall in the market where she sells vegetables such as lettuce, spring onions, parsley, spinach, and others. This work is done in the early morning hours and she returns home by noon. She is a hard-working person. She states she never gets tired, because everything she does is for her family. She says they deserve everything.

Sonia is requesting a loan to buy clothes to better stock her small store and continue to offer variety to her customers, because they are used to it.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 55 years old, married, and has 8 children - one child is in school. 

Charito has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has been in this business for 15 years.  She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

 In the future, Charito would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Vituosas Group

texts.es:
El comite Mujeres Virtuosas está integrado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas vieron en el programa de la fundación paraguaya, una gran ayuda, que les será muy útil, y con lo cual podrán ayudar a sus familias.
Cada una de ellas pone lo mejor de si, y de esa forma se ayudan y están saliendo adelante. Una de ellas es la Sra. Francisca, quien se dedica a la costura, y quien nos comenta que gracias a la ayuda de fundación y de su grupo ha podido crecer mucho.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, y con ello poder cumplir con una serie de pedidos que tiene, ya que no le gustaría decepcionar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Virtuosas (Virtuous Women) is formed by 12 women from the city of San Lorenzo.  They saw in the Fundación Paraguaya program a great benefit that would be very useful for them, and with which they would be able to help their families. Each one of them does her best, and in this way they help each other and are advancing. 

One of them is Señora Francisca, who works as a dressmaker and who comments that thanks to the help of the Foundation and her group, she has been able to grow a lot.  She is applying for the loan to purchase fabrics and thread, and with them she will be able to complete a series of orders that she has, since she would not like to disappoint her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
Gemmalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. She also earns more income from general store.

Gemmalyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Gemmalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Dzombo

texts.en:
Dzombo, 34 years old, is married with two children. He is a motorcycle taxi operator. He bought his own motorcycle 2 years ago and since then has been working providing services to his vicinity. He has been engaged in this work for 2 years.

Dzombo has told us that this type of work requires a lot of sacrifice. In order to obtain a decent wage, he has to work at night, particularly in the early morning hours. For this reason, his job can be quite dangerous.  However, he is thankful that he is able to earn a decent wage and maintain his family. He feels it is particularly important that his children go to school and is thankful that this job has allowed him to do this. 

He has asked for a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi and do general servicing.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi and do general servicing.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El Señor Nicolas es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene un hijo, el señor es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos de bazar y cubiertos en Gral., y tiene un vehículo propio. Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto. Empezó a trabajar como macatero por la zona de Almeida y Guayaybi, en una motocicleta, su sueño de siempre era de tener un camión para poder trabajar bien y abarcar mas zonas y así conseguir nuevos clientes y aumentar sus ingresos y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
El señor solicita el crédito para la compra de cubiertas para su vehículo, ya que necesitan reparación y este es su medio de trabajo, sin el cual no puede estar. Agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues es muy importante para él.
texts.en:
Nicolas is from the city of Santaní. He has one son and he is a merchant. He works selling products in a bazar and silverware in general. He has his own vehicle. He is a very hard worker, responsible and very honest. He began to work as a merchant in the areas of Almeida and Guayaybi on a motorcycle. His dream has always been to have a truck to be able to work well and expand to more areas and in this way acquire new clients. This would increase his earnings and by this means help his family. 

He seeks this loan to buy covers for his vehicle now that they need to be repaired and this is his means of work, without which it can't continue. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving because it is very important to him.

loans.use: to buy  covers for a work vehicle.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra Angela tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, cada uno de ellos son profesionales e independientes, que la ayudan con el sustento de la casa y los gastos.
La Sra. Angela es de profesión peluquera hace más de 30 años- Su nuevo emprendimiento es habilitar una mercería actividad la cual la viene realizando en sus viajes a la Argentina, de donde se abastece y trae productos para vender. Ella es una persona muy dinámica, que siempre trabaja y quiere  seguir haciéndolo.
El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de roperías, carteras, vaqueros y materia prima e insumos.
texts.en:
Señora Angela is 57 years old. She is single and has three adult children, each of whom has a career and is independent, and they help her with the upkeep of the house and expenses.

Sra. Angela has had a more than 30-year career as a hairdresser. Her new venture is to set up a general store, an activity that she has been carrying out on her trips to Argentina, where she stocks up and brings products to sell. She is a very dynamic person who always works and wants to continue doing so.

She is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of clothing, purses, jeans, and other staples and supplies.

loans.use: to buy clothing, purses, jeans, and other staples and supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Idoneas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación se encuentra en el ciclo número 15, donde todas ellas han visto un gran progreso en sus laborales y desean seguir trabajando y ayudando a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Rebeca, ella se dedica a la venta de panificados en todas sus variedades y también es modista. Cuenta la Sra. Rebeca  que solicita  crédito para la compra de insumos para los panificados, como ser harina, levadura, sal, azúcar, manteca y demás.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación is in its 15th loan cycle, where all of the members have seen great progress in their livelihoods, and wish to keep working and helping their families.

One of the group members is Rebeca. She sells baked goods in all their varieties, and is also a dressmaker. Rebeca says that she is applying for a loan to purchase ingredients for the baked goods, such as flour, yeast, salt, sugar, lard and other things.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, salt, sugar, lard and other ingredients.

loans.name: Candelaria De Jesus

texts.es: Para Candelaria su interés es responder las necesidades de sus clientes por eso su anterior credikiva lo invirtió  en la compra  de cosméticos, carnes frías, prendas de vestir, artículos para el hogar entre otros; en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará una vez mas y en mayor volumen, cosméticos, carnes frías, prendas de vestir y artículos para el hogar; Candelaria se siente feliz con el apoyo brindado y desea que continúen brindándonos este apoyo tan valioso, es su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva.
texts.en: Candelaria's interest is meeting the needs of her customers, and so she invested her past Kiva loan in the purchase of cosmetics, cold meats, articles of clothing, and household items, among other things. Now she is applying for a Kiva loan with which she will again buy, in larger quantity, cosmetics, cold meats, articles of clothing, and household items. Candelaria feels happy about the support offered and wants them to continue offering this help that is so valuable -- this is her message to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, cold meats, articles of clothing, and household items to sell

loans.name: Vendi

texts.en: Vendi comes from Lembata, Flores, in Indonesia. He is 17 years old and comes from a very simple family. His parents work as simple merchants in Lembata. Lembata is a small village near the beach. Almost all of the people there work as fishermen. Vendi wants to become an expert administration officer in a maritime company in his village. He is looking for a loan to continue his education and pay any fees for the Maritime Academy in Cilacap, which is very far away from Lembata. His parents are unable to pay for his education fees in the Maritime Academy because there are still three of his siblings who are really young and need more money for their life and education. Vendi is asking for help to make his hopes come true with your loans, which will help Vendi and make his family’s life better in the future.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Yeremias

texts.en: Yeremias has wanted to be an expert in office administration ever since he was studying at the Christian Vocational School in his village of Sanur-Nunukan (the border between Indonesia and Malaysia), part of Kalimantan Island. Yeremias is 19 years old. His father works as a security man for an oil palm company with very low wages. He has two older siblings who are already in the school near their village, so his parents don't have enough money to pay for his education fees at the Maritime Academy. If he can finish his education at that academy, he wants to be an employee of the Seamanship Company or in the department of sea relationship in his village. Yeremias is requesting a loan from Kiva and YSBS to pay for his education fees at the Maritime Academy in Cilacap. He hopes that a lot of students like him can get loans to continue their education in Indonesia.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Mariana Cecibel

texts.es:
Mariana inicio con su negocio hace casi 5 años cuando se cambio de casa . Al momento de cambiarce observo que por el sector de mucho lote, no habia negocios de papeleria ni de cyber para las personas del sector con ayuda y capital de su esposo comenzo con su papeleria. En la actualida trabaja por las mañanas hasta las 22:00pm. Tambien tiene un pequeño cyber con computadoras para los clientes. 

El esposo de Mariana trabaja en  Holcim como chofer  y tiene 2 hijos en escuela y colegio fiscal.
Con el préstamo va a comprar  hojas, cuadernos y 2 computadoras para su cyber. Unas de sus metas es poder incrementar su negocio y más adelante ampliar su negocio porque con eso ayuda y sustenta a su familia
texts.en:
Mariana started her business almost five years ago, when she moved to a different house. At the time she moved, she noted that around this well-populated part of the city, there were no stationery stores nor Internet cafés for people in the area. 

With help and capital from her husband, she started off with her stationery store. Currently she works from the morning until 10:00pm. She also has a small Internet café with computers for the customers.

Mariana's husband works as a driver at Holcim (a large cement company), and she has two children in school; one in primary, and one in high school. 

With the loan, she is going to buy sheets of paper, notebooks and two computers for her Internet café.

One of her goals is to be able to increase her business, and someday expand it; because that is how she helps and supports her family.

loans.use: To buy sheets of paper, notebooks and two computers.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар полна позитивными энергиями. Ей 19 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она научилась шить женскую одежду и теперь хочет организовать свой собственный бизнес и стать богатой бизнес леди. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nilufar is full of positive energy. She is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents. 

Nilufar learned how to sew women's clothing and now wants to establish her own business and become a wealthy businesswoman. To this end, she studied in a course entitled "Achieve Success" organized by the Association of Business Women, for which she earned a certificate. 

Nilufar now wants to start a business and become successful at it. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000 Tajikistan Somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine for this purpose. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine to establish a new business

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en: Lukas has lived in the Alor District of West Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia since he was born 21 years ago. Alor is a small village with very low economic growth, even though in that village there are a lot of small harbors, because the education level is really low. Lukas' parents work as farmers with income of only 150,000 IDR (around $16 US) per month. He has three brothers who are nine, eight and five years old. His brothers can’t go to school anymore. Lukas chose to leave his village because he really wants to continue his education in the Maritime Academy. Lukas hopes that the loan from Kiva will give him a challenge to make his family's living conditions better, because when he graduates from the Maritime Academy, he will get a job on a National or International ship as a professional sailor and will get a good salary. This way he can help all his brothers continue their education for their future. He knows that his parents will be very grateful if he can finish his education at the Maritime Academy in Cilacap because of the loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Rohim

texts.en: Rohim is the youngest child of three in his family. He is 18 years old and just finishing his vocational school in Cilacap. His father is only a merchant in a traditional market and this situation makes him worry that he can’t continue his education like his siblings who only finished secondary school. He wants to be a sailor and have an opportunity to work on a big ship like an international freighter or cargo ship, but his parents don't have enough money for him to continue his education. He is requesting a loan to pay for his education, so he can help his parents in the future.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Soleh

texts.en: Since Soleh was 10 years old, he has been living in Majenang, a small but growing village. However, the educational level of people in his village is really low. So that situation makes him, at 18 years old, want to continue his education at a higher school in Cilacap District. He realizes that he can’t ask for money from his parents, who are just workers who cultivate other people's fields, and there is one younger brother who is still in elementary school and needs more of his parents help for his education and fees. So Soleh is asking for a loan to continue his education at the Maritime Academy in Cilacap, because he heard from his friend that it is easier for alumni of that Academy to get a job in Indonesia. Please help him to make his dream come true so that he can help his youngest brother to continue his education in the future.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn is 34 years old and single.

Ma. Lyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Ma. Lyn has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns income from electronic re-loading (sale of electronic credits used for cell phone service or cash transfers).

Ma. Lyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.ru: Мехрангезу 19 лет. Она умеет шить женскую одежду. Так как она не замужем и живет с родителями,  решила помочь родителям для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mehrangez is 19 years old, and she can sew women's clothing. Because she is single and lives with her parents, she decided to contribute to the welfare of the family by taking a course entitled "Achieve Success," organized by the Association of Businesswomen. She earned a certificate for her studies. 

Mehrangez is now seeking a loan in the amount of 2,500 Tajikistan Somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine so that she can establish a new business. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to establish a new business

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 20 years old and comes from the Belu District in Atambua. Belu is on the border of Indonesia and Timor Leste. Belu is part of Indonesia, with a lot of small harbors. Thomas' father works as a driver and sometimes is a car mechanic with an income of only 500.000 IDR a month, which covers just the basic needs of his family. Thomas has four siblings. The three youngest can’t continue their school and his brother had to drop out a few years ago because his father couldn't pay the educational fees for all of his children. Thomas heard that Maritime Academy in Cilacap gives student loans for poor families like his. So, he went to Cilacap and asked for a loan from Kiva through YSBS, in the hopes that with the loan, he can continue his studies in higher education. His dream is to work back in his village where there are a lot of Seamanship Companies. Then he can help his parents improve his family's living conditions. Thomas needs a loan from you.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia esposa y un hijo el hijo tiene veintitrés años de edad no tiene familiares en el extranjero, trabaja desde hace 35 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor en pequeño su horario es de siete a doce pm.
Ha solicitado un préstamo porque el cual lo invertirá en  el cultivo de maiz en dos manzanas de tierra, esto debera aplicarle abono, herbicidas, insecticidas,que son necesarios para la produccion, el cultivo beneficiara a él y su familia, teniendo una buena produccion para poder mejorar la estabilidad economica y alimenticia.
Su objetivo es a traves del trabajo llevar la alimentación diaria a su  familia y crecer en la producción.
texts.en:
José lives with his family, his wife and a son. The son is 23 years old. He does not have relatives living abroad. He has been working since he was 35 years old as small farmer. His schedule is from 7 to 12 pm.

He has applied for a loan to invest in growing corn on two manzanas of land (about 3.5 acres). He will need to apply compost, herbicides, and insecticides, which are necessary for production. The crop will benefit him and his family; having a good production will improve their economic stability and sustenance.

His goal is to bring daily sustenance to his family through his work and to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 24 years old. He is single. He has been a maize farmer for four years. He plans to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at another maize farming plantation. Samuel was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support the labor costs in the maize production.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen invirtió su crédito anterior en vestuario, calzado, productos del hogar y aseo personal y logró incrementar su clientela. Su nuevo crédito lo invertirá en calzado, vestuario, productos por catalogo y mercancía en general; ella siente que tendrá éxito por su clientela selecta, porque las ventas son pedidos anticipados de sus clientes y la mayoría trabajan y generan ingresos. Ella está muy dispuesta a fortalecer y  continuar con su miscelánea, Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:  “Gracias por el apoyo; de los pequeños negocios, nacen las grandes empresas”
texts.en:
Carmen invested her previous loan in clothing, shoes, and home and personal hygiene products – and she was able to increase her customer base. With this new loan, she will invest in shoes, clothes, catalogue products, and other merchandise. She feels like she will be successful, because her sales are based on customers’ requests, and her customers work and have steady incomes. 

She is committed to strengthening and continue her business, and her message to Kiva investors is: “Thank you for your support; big corporations are born from small businesses”

loans.use: Will invest in shoes, clothes, catalogue products, and other merchandise

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: Felicidad es propietaria de una confección que nació porque  sus progenitores la practicaban  y ella ha continuado su tradición, por eso en la actualidad y a sus 57 años,  su meta principal es lograr poco a poco, la ampliación de su infraestructura, invirtiendo en maquinaria y trabajadores; a nivel personal seguir viviendo al lado de su esposo el resto de su vida. Ella cuenta que su mayor desafío es persistir en el aumento de su mercado,  a pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentan, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima e insumos, porque confeccionará  uniformes de trabajo, que ha solicitado un taller de mecánica, inversión que será exitosa entendiendo que esta ampliará su capital de trabajo y la cobertura de sus clientes que es la tarea diaria a la que se dedica, ofreciendo calidad en las prendas de vestir y en su amable servicio.
texts.en: Felicidad is the proprietor of a tailoring shop that began because her parents practiced this type of work and she has continued their tradition.  At this time, at the age of 57, her principal goal is to succeed, little by little, in expanding her infrastructure, investing in machinery and workers. On a personal level, her goal is to continue living alongside her husband for the rest of her life. She relates that her greatest challenge is to persist in increasing her market, in spite of the obstacles that arise for her. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan to invest in the purchase of basic materials and supplies, because she will make work uniforms that a mechanics shop has requested. This is an investment that will be successful, understanding that it will increase her working capital and the range of her customers. This is her daily work, offering quality in her articles of clothing and in her friendly service.

loans.use: to buy basic materials and supplies to make clothing.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She borrowed 25,000 Kenya shillings and plans to use the entire loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, salts, rice and maize flour for resale. 

With the anticipated profits, she plans to invest back into the shop and use some to support her family. She hopes to manage the business well so as to attain maximum profits.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, salts, rice and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 52 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 30 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at another maize farming plantation. Silas was very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during the maize production.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 27 years old. He is married to a farmer and has two children. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay for  labor costs and fertilizer during his maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at another maize farming plantation. Evariste was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Azmi

texts.en:
Azmi is photographed next to his taxi. He is a 21-year-old single young man.
For the past four years, Azmi has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him. However, it also needs some support from time to time.
Azmi is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of installing new wheels and pay for insuring and licensing the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's ability to work extra hours and enable Azmi to travel from one area to another legally, which will improve his income positively and ensure a better future for him.

loans.use: To cover the cost of changing the wheels, licensing, and insuring the taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, oil, cereal, and detergent.

loans.name: Elsy

texts.es: Elsy está aplicando a un primer credikiva en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual invertirá   en un cubetero Cubic 50, el cual tiene la propiedad de congelar más rápido la bolsa de agua, porque quiere mejorar su actividad de fabricar hielo, de la que dependen los ingresos que ella aporta a su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y su hija de 21 años de edad. Cuando inició su negocio lo hizo vendiendo desde su nevera y por los buenos resultados,  compró un congelador para vender al por Mayor y al Detal, su meta mas adelante es tener un cuarto frio para no solo vender hielo, sino también producir helados. Su plan de vida la lleva a soñar con mejorar los dormitorios y cuarto de baños de su casa y esto muy seguramente lo conseguirá con su esfuerzo y el de su cónyuge. Ella tiene 3 años de experiencia y vende directamente desde su domicilio; Sus ventas las realiza de contado y con una frecuencia diaria, que inicia desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche entre sus clientes están diversos comerciantes informales del municipio de Soledad, y habitantes del sector, a quienes quiere atraer cada vez mas para fidelizarlos y aumentar sus ingresos .
texts.en:
Elsy is applying to her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she plans to use to invest on a 50 cubic freezer that will allow her to make the ice she sells to contribute to her household income. 

She lives with her husband and her 21-year old daughter. She started her business selling ice from her refrigerator, and after good results she bought a freezer to sell the ice at retail and wholesale. Her goal is to have a cold room from which not only sell ice, but also ice cream. 

Her dream is to improve her home’s bedrooms and bathrooms as result of her and her husband’s hard work.

She has 3 years of experience selling from her home. Her sales are made in cash, and she is opened daily from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. Among her customers, she has several merchants from the area, and local residents. She wants to build a loyal customer base to increase her income.

loans.use: Invest in a 50 Cubic Freezer.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 39 years old. He is married to a teacher. He has been a maize farmer for 15 years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer during his maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at another maize farming plantation. Jean Claude was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 46 years old, married and has 8 children. Hassan told us he now wants to start a small store to stock with basic consumer goods. He is anticipating to earn good profits out of it and be able to provide better life to his family. He is a very hard-working and tenacious man, always making efforts to get ahead in life. He is requesting a loan to buy more general products such as rice, cooking fat, flour, sugar, oil and baked products. Thanks to this investment which he is looking forward to make, he will keep on selling high quality products. He is looking forward for your support.

loans.use: to buy more general products such as rice, cooking fat, flour, sugar, oil and baked products.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Lisbeth  tiene 40 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias como ama de casa ella cocina y ve a sus hijos para ayudarlos o apoyarlos en lo que más necesiten aun que ya son grandes pero la socia aun esta ahi para apoyarlos , la socia a la vez ayuda a su esposo en su negocio de taller automotriz , la socia administra el negocio de su esposo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar repuestos de carro como faros para el negocio de su esposo.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Durabank” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Lisbeth divides her time between her daily activities as a homemaker and helping her husband with his auto repair shop. She cooks, watches over her children, and provides them with what they need most. Now that her children are older, she does not spend as much time looking after them. Lisbeth is in charge of managing her husband’s business. She is a responsible and industrious person who works in order to help her family move forward.

Lisbeth is requesting a loan in order to buy auto parts, such as headlights, for her husband’s business. She is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, such as headlights, for her husband's auto repair business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is from Gango Rizal, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old. Roselyn is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Roselyn has been providing transportation services to local community member for 12 years and earns 5,000 a month for these activities. In 2009, Roselyn joined GDMPC. Roselyn is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily allowances.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en: Anacita is 42 years old. She is the wife of a farmer who owns a business buying and selling bottles as a source of income. She earns PHP 150 every day, which is usually used for daily expenses. This income is very minimal for her family, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more bottles to sell. She hopes that her loan will be a great help in improving her income.

loans.use: buy recycled bottles to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
This is Angelita, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jeter and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Angelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  Angelita  earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Angelita is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Angelita hopes to grow her business and dreams that her children will all finish college through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to restock her general store

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Saren is a 38-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her. Some are in school and some help the family’s business. She has farmed rice on a 1.5 hectare area of farmland for eighteen years and complemented her family’s income by selling grocery items. She can earn around 20,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. The main challenge for her paddy-field is drought, which lowers her yield.

This is the first loan for Saren’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group of four to apply for a loan. As the leader, Saren, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying grocery items to sell. She hopes to plant her rice fruitfully and healthfully so as to increase her income in order to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre de  años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba,  pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Segundo trabaja en el rubro de transporte, él cuenta con 2 mototaxis, las cuales una de ella utiliza para trabajar como chofer y la otra la alquila, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, Segundo puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Segundo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de parte de su vivienda, él podrá comprar los materiales que necesita y también podrá hacer el tarrajeo de su vivienda; de esta manera Segundo tendrá su hogar en mejores condiciones, más seguras y adecuadas para su desarrollo, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su empresa de transporte y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Segundo is a single gentleman who lives in the city of Chiclayo. He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic individual who has the drive to succeed. Unfortunately, he lacked the financial resources to earn the professional law degree that he wanted to pursue. Even though he needed to work, he greatly enjoys what he does for a living.

With great effort, enthusiasm, and his own initiative, Segundo began working in the transportation sector. He owns two motorcycle taxis, one that he uses for his own work and another that he offers for rent. Every day he begins his work in the early morning hours. Segundo travels the streets of the city in search of passengers. He works approximately 12 hours a day and believes he is doing well because of his dedication and the friendly service that he offers to his customers.

Segundo is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to complete part of the construction of his home. He will buy materials that he needs for plastering his house. This will provide better and safer conditions so that his family can adequately develop. In the not-so-distant future, he will work and strive toward establishing his own transportation company so that he can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for plastering his house.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La socia Angela tiene 33 años,es casada y tiene 1 hijo,la socia se dedica al negocio de tienda de venta de regalos,al socia vende peluches,perfumes,juguetes entre otros regalos,la socia tambien trabaja en una hotel como administradora,la socia en su negocio de venta de regalos tiene 8 años y le va muy bien y por medio de su trabajo y su negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijo,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local donde vende regalos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar peluches,perfumes y juguetes al por mnayor para implementar su tienda de venta regalos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Angela is 33 years old, married, and has one child. She operates a gift shop where she sells stuffed animals, perfumes, toys, and other items. Angela also works at a hotel as a manager. She has been selling gifts for eight years and has done very well. Through her job and her business, she is able to help her son move forward. Her dream is to expand her gift shop.

Angela is requesting a loan in order to buy stuffed animals, perfumes, and toys in bulk so that she can keep her gift shop in operation. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals, perfumes, and toys in bulk.

loans.name: Simon Pierre

texts.en:
Simon Pierre is 49 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have seven children. He has been a maize farmer for 16 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

In the photo taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation, he was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Papianus

texts.en: Papianus was born in 1991. He graduated from a Government Vocational School in Pontianak, West Kalimantan. He wants to continue his education at the Academy because he wants to be a technical expert in boat engineering in the future. But he realizes that his parents are just farmers and they earn only 1,000,000 IDR per month to cover all the costs of the family, which includes five children. He would like to get this loan so he can pay for his educational fees at the Nusantara Maritime Academy in Cilacap. He hopes to finish his schooling so he can help his parents with the family expenses later on.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of 11 children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Dolores is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy new equipment for her tricycle.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her tricycle.

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité cuenta con doce integrantes en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, ya que ven una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en la formación del grupo.
Claudia es peluquera, comenta que siempre está muy cargada de muchos clientes ya que es muy buena profesional. Todos sus clientes siempre salen muy contentos con su trabajo. Su sueño es poder tener el día de mañana una gran peluquería y de esa forma también poder dar trabajo a las demás personas que necesiten.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de peines, shampoo, enjuagues, spray, etc, con lo cual abastecerá su local y así seguirá dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee consists of 12 members who all have small businesses. These women are very excited about having this great opportunity to grow as a group.

Claudia is a beautician who is always busy with many customers since she is a very good professional. All of her customers always leave her establishment happy with the work she has done. Her dream is to someday have a larger salon where she can provide jobs to other people who need them.

Claudia is requesting a loan in order to buy combs, shampoo, rinses, sprays, and other supplies that she needs to restock her salon and continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy combs, shampoo, rinses, sprays, and other supplies.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 41 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 28 years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
